title: Simulation-Based Medical Education Course Using High-Fidelity Virtual Patient Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Emphasizing team-based activities in simulation labs with pre-learning material access via personal devices (BYOD). Providing immediate feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: In a high-fidelity simulated patient environment, learners can accurately assess patient symptoms and determine appropriate treatment priorities
By performing clinical decisions according to simulated patient scenarios within 15 minutes, learners improve time management skills
After simulations, learners can analyze and reflect on their clinical behaviors using the Stimulated Recall interview technique

resources: Simulated Patient Kit (Materials for Recreating Skin Symptoms, Wounds, and Postural Deformities)
High-Fidelity Simulation Equipment (Virtual Patient Monitoring System)
Team-based tablet PCs (utilizing pre-learning materials and assessment checklists)
Video recording equipment (for stimulated recall interviews)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
